title: Inside the expert network training every frontier AI model | Garrett Lord
themes: AI data labeling and model training
Building new businesses within existing companies
key_insights: The shift from generalist to expert data labeling creates massive opportunities for companies with access to specialized talent
Models have largely exhausted pre-training gains and now require expert-created post-training data for improvement
Starting a new business within an existing company requires complete separation - different teams, office space, metrics, and compensation
The only moat in human data is access to an audience - customer acquisition costs are the killer for most competitors
AI-native young people have significant advantages in the job market due to their familiarity with AI tools
Leave nothing to chance when facing unlimited demand - execution speed and quality are everything
Expert data labeling involves finding model weaknesses and providing step-by-step corrections, not just right answers
Building trust through university partnerships creates sustainable competitive advantages over performance marketing approaches
topics_discussed: What data labeling actually involves for AI model training
Pre-training vs post-training in AI model development
Supervised fine-tuning (SFT) and reinforcement learning with human feedback (RLHF)
The shift from generalist to expert data workers
Trajectory data and multimodal AI training
Building Handshake AI from zero to $50M ARR in 4 months
Strategies for launching new businesses within existing companies
The future of job markets and AI-native workers
Quality control and verification in data labeling
Scaling expert networks across academic disciplines
Customer acquisition costs in the data labeling market
Building trust-based platforms vs transactional marketplaces
Hiring and team structure for hypergrowth
The role of synthetic vs human-generated data
memorable_quotes: There will never be a time like this. I've never seen anything like it. I doubt I'll ever feel anything like this in business again where there's unlimited demand.
The only moat in human data is access to an audience.
The models have gotten so good that the generalists are no longer needed. What they really need is experts.
frameworks_mentioned: Quality, volume, and speed framework for data providers
LTV to CAC ratio in marketplace businesses
Leave nothing to chance execution philosophy
Separate everything approach for internal startups
summary: Garrett Lord shares how Handshake built a $50M ARR AI data labeling business in 4 months by leveraging their network of university students and experts to create high-quality training data for frontier AI models. The episode reveals the mechanics of AI model training, the shift from generalist to expert data work, and proven strategies for launching successful new businesses within existing companies.
